Could black holes have such large gravitational pull because of their displacement of space, not accumulation of mass?

And, why do objects never collide (hardly ever) directly head on if they are attracted through gravity caused by their mass?
Objects always seem to barely miss each other and start a orbit around each other. Which would lead one to conclude, at least this dummy, that it's the displacement of space that causes this attraction.
With gravity being able to reach out so far, and being so weak, is also another indicator that it's not mass that causes gravity but it's the distortion of space. Like ripples in a pond reaching out for thousands of feet from a small disturbance.
